headline: Old-Fashioned Carrot Cake
description: Here's an old-fashioned carrot cake that's got more carrots than spice. Pecans can be substituted for walnuts.
name: Old-Fashioned Carrot Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Set aside.

In a large bowl, mix together sugar, oil, eggs, vanilla, and buttermilk. Stir in carrots, coconut, vanilla, and pineapple. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt; gently stir into carrot mixture. Stir in chopped nuts. Spread batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 55 minutes or until toothpick inserted into cake comes out clean. Remove from oven, and set aside to cool.
In a medium mixing bowl, combine butter or margarine, cream cheese, vanilla, and confectioners sugar. Blend until creamy. Frost cake while still in the pan.

review.reviewBody: Made it for Valentineâ€™s Day. Very good.
Very good and moist! Added 1/2 c white raisins, reduced the salt to 1 tsp and omitted the nuts (not a fan of them in my cake). I will make this again.
Yum!

I made this cake for a birthday lunch and it was very flavorful and moist. I did not change anything in the recipe and was pleased with the results. The next time I make it, though, I will probably modify the frosting a bit and cut back on the confectioners sugar and add more cream cheese, but that is the only thing I would change. Thank you for sharing this recipe!

My daughter made this cake as a 2 layer for Easter. This was the most fabulous carrot cake I've ever tasted. So moist and delicious with the perfect amount of spice. The addition of the pineapple and coconut makes an average cake an extraordinary one!

I love Carrot Cake, and I'll have to admit that this was my first ever attempt to make a cake without a box that I could dig out of the garbage and reread the instructions.. it didn't go without any issues, but.. I didn't account for the extra liquid in the pineapple and carrots so I had to add extra flour to get the consistency I knew that I needed from those box cakes that I learned on. So with that being said, I love Carrot Cake, and this was a fantastic recipe and made an excellent cake. One of the best I've ever had, and I've had quite a few..ðŸ˜‹

I made this recipe into cupcakes for Easter. Really moist and delicious. Here are my adjustments: added 1 tsp of ginger powder, 1 tsp allspice and 1 tsp nutmeg to make it more flavorful. The reason Iâ€™m giving this a 4 start rating, is because I can taste the baking soda. I would have to replace it with another leavening agent. Not sure what yet. I reduced the baking time to around 30 minutes for the cupcakes instead of the suggested time for an actual cake.
Delicious, moist cake that is easy to prepare.
Yes will make it again
EXCELLENT!!! Did not change anything and everyone raved about it! Was truly delicious!

I did not like this cake. It is very oily and tastes like oil. Also, it didn't rise well, i thought it was odd that there isn't any baking powder in it but alot of salt. You can taste the salt. I don't recommend it.
Yummy
In my previous review, I forgot to mention that because you are frosting only the top of a 9x13 cake, half the icing would be enough.

This recipe, even 
without the pineapple was so wet and soggy after 2hrs!! of baking. At 1hour and 30 minutes, I even turned up the heat to 375Â°. I am an experienced baker and my oven works on my own recipes just fine. Unless you want to waste out a bunch of food, DON'T BOTHER.
Turned out great - just like my Grandmaâ€™s!
Delicious carrot cake!! The icing was amazing but very sweet
YUMM. the frosting recipe makes a LOT. Also I substituted half the sugar for brown sugar and it is AMAZING. 10/10 recommend.
I made this and took it to a dinner partyâ€¦ it was a hit and Iâ€™ve been asked several times to make another one since then. So I did last night and, once again, it practically disappeared.

Made this cake for a family picnic and everyone loved it. I left out the coconut since many in my family are not fans of it. It was very moist. The only thing I would do differently next time is to reserve about 1/2 of a cup of the icing...it got pretty thick in many places on the cake. Everyone wants the recipe now.

Both the cake and frosting were a flop. Tons of great ingredients wasted. The cake had baking soda, but no powder and did not rise. Suggest sugar be half brown/1/2 white. Very hefty, damp, cake 1/2" thick. Frosting way to runny even after refrigerating. Happy (not) Easter.
Great recipe! Very moist and not overly dense.
the best ever
Love it very moist delicious, I added raisins and it taste amazing...
wonderful!

I've made this recipe twice now, and both times to rave reviews. For the time I made the one in the picture, I doubled the frosting recipe so that I could play with the decorating. This last time, I just made the standard amount, and had a "nearly naked" look to the cake. The only comment I have is that 55 minutes in the oven for 2 cake rounds would be too long. The recipe is for a 9 x 13 pan. Thirty-five to forty minutes is plenty for a toothpick to come out clean for 2 cake rounds. I actually checked it at 33 minutes and it was fine. Try this cake!
Followed the recipe and it turned out fantastic! Substituted walnuts with pecans. I recommend trying this!
Best carrot cake ever! Added 1/2 c butter along with 3/4 c oil in batter and halved the icing sugar.
Iâ€™ve made this a few times already, itâ€™s a crowd favorite. Thanks for the sharing this recipe! Super easy to make and tastes amazing!
excellent cake delish frosting but so much frosting! I'll probably cut the frosting recipe in half next time
This recipe made a soft and delicious cake. Would recommend. My family LOVED it.

Best carrot cake in the world! I made this for a birthday and everybody loved it and wanted more! They said that it was either the best carrot cake they ever had, or THE best cake they ever had. If you haven't made this you should! I would make this again!
Excellent recipe! My only changes were adding 1 tsp of nutmeg, and 1/2 tsp of allspice, and decreasing cinnamon to 1 tsp. Super easy cake to make....it's now a favorite recipe of mine. Thank you
This is one of the best carrot cake recipes I've tried, the only change I made was adding a 1/4 cup raisins.

Wow. One of the easiest, most delicious cakes I've ever made. I only used 1 c sugar and instead of buttermilk used a 5.3 oz container of plain coconut yogurt. The first time I made it in a bundt cake pan (baked at 350 for 55 min) and the second time I made it into 24 cupcakes (baked at 350 for 28 minutes-always just check for doneness with a toothpick around 22 min). I made my frosting with 16 oz cream cheese, 1/2 c butter, dash of vanilla, 1/2 c confectioners sugar and a few tablespoons of the pineapple juice left from the crushed pineapple (as another reviewer suggested). Not too sweet. The whole thing was perfect!
Perfect cake.
Kids loved it!

Baked in 3 8" round pans for about 30 minutes.
Used 2 8 oz blocks cream cheese instead of 1 and reduced the powdered sugar to 2 cups.

This will be my new birthday cake from now on!! It is THE BEST carrot cake Iâ€™ve ever had- and Iâ€™ve had many! I followed the recipe exactly and it was deliciously moist. The frosting was perfect. I considered adding raisins because I love raisins in my carrot cake but honestly, I wouldnâ€™t change a thing.
Excellent!! Super Moist. Everybody loved it.
Too easy! Following the directions as written and it came out delicious. Higher
This is sooooooo good!!

I loved this cake, very moist. For the frosting I used a highbred cream cheese and brown butter. 1c browned butter, 1, 8oz package of cream cheese and powdered sugar until the consistency is to your liking and a tsp. of vanilla. I would definitely make this cake again!
Absolute hit with the whole family! Only alteration was omitted the coconut and used 3 cups of carrots. Will be making this again!

Iâ€™ve been making carrot cake for years and itâ€™s been my favorite kind of cake since I was a kid. This recipe is the best Iâ€™ve ever made! I didnâ€™t use the coconut and I used pecans instead of walnuts. I also purÃ©ed the pineapple in a food processor and used the cream cheese icing 2 recipe for the icing. The cake was so moist and delicious! Exactly what I want in a carrot cake.
I used Philadelphiaâ€™s Blueberries Cream Cheese for the frosting since that is what I had handy. Absolutely delicious!

Nice recipe. I made a few adjustments for taste and texture. I substitued the coconut for 1 and 1/4 cup of oats, reduced the sugar by 1/4 cup (could reduce even more), and substitued 1 of the cups of flour with whole meal flour. Added an extra 1/4 cup of flour to make the cake a bit more firm. Added 3/4 cups of raisins. Replaced one of the teaspons of cinnamon with ground nutmeg. Baked in a bundt cake pan and drizzled icing (made it a bit more runny and made a lot less than recipe). Decorated with grated carrots and raisins. This is how much my son ate in one sitting! We'll have to get him to slow down a bit.

This was so darn good. It was my first time ever baking anything from scratch and first time ever making a frosting and both came out great. It made a huge cake and I think next time Iâ€™ll just split everything in half and make a smaller batch. It was moist, tender, and delicious. I didnâ€™t really know how to blend the mixture for the frosting so I had to YouTube that but it was still a good recipe.
My husband loves carrot cake. The kids and I not so much. This recipe is perfect. With the added coconut it tastes more tropical

Let me just say i give this 5 stars!that I am blind so my picture is probably horrible! But this cake was delicious!! I was going to make this in January but nobody was impressed by the coconut and pineapple in the recipe. I made it yesterday and we donâ€™t have any leftovers today LOL it was very easy to follow the recipe. I would totally recommend ??
This is the best carrot cake I've ever eaten! The only change I made was I subbed raisins for the coconut.

This cake is delicious and SOOOO easy and SOOOO moist! The hardest part is grating the carrots and that's not hard. The icing was too sweet for me so the next time I made it, I used less confectioner's sugar. Almost a cup less! It really was too much. The cake is sweet enough by itself.
I made this today and it was absolutely delicious. My grandpa loves carrot cake and his mother made it the best and he said it is on the same level of his moms! The best recipe Iâ€™ve made!

I followed the recipe exactly except instead of oil I used butter flavored Crisco sticks? (3/4 cup), I added golden raisins and only put some crushed walnuts on top rather than inside, my family is not huge on walnuts. Very delicious and moist cake.?
Absolutely the best carrot cake I have ever had. That is. It only my opinion but all of my tasters have said the same!
I just made this and it didnt rise at all it sunk and was like bread pudding almost and I followed the recipe to a T. So disappointed
Excellent recipe. Very moist. I omitted nuts. I used a half cup of raisins instead. Also added a half teaspoon of dried ginger. Lots of compliments!
Fantastic, this was great and the best carrot cake I have ever made. I did leave out the coconut, changed the walnuts to pecans, and threw in 1/2 of raisins.

This is the best carrot cake recipe Iâ€™ve ever tried. My husband also says itâ€™s the best heâ€™s ever had. Itâ€™s not cakey, is very moist and full of texture and isnâ€™t overly sweet. The cream cheese frosting is so good too. I baked it for the exact time the recipe directed and it was perfect. This recipe will now be in my collection.
Good. Way too sweet. Half the sugar was better. But then the frosting was also way too sweet compared to other recipes - there are better ones on this site.
Turned out excellent following the recipe as written.
My family love it! When I made this cake I used pumpkin puree instead of crushed pineapple.
Very moist and dense cake. Delicious. I think next time I will add a bit more cinnamon, just my personal preference.
It came out to a little too much frosting but overall it was amazing!!

Perfect!! I followed this recipe almost exactly. I left out the pineapple just because I donâ€™t like it in my carrot cake. This recipe is amazing!! I love it so much!! Iâ€™ll be making it this way from now on.
the cake is good,the frosting needs to be adjusted ,4 cups of confectionary sugar ruined it...
Best carrot cake I've ever eaten. Stuck to the recipe except for no nuts. Moist and delicious!
I added 1/4 cup raisins in addition to all other ingredients.

I made the cake and the frosting, it came out perfect. Make sure to use the correct pan too! Thank you for this awesome recipe and I will 100% be making it again. This is perfect for Thanksgiving and I am very excited to give this to my family.

I'm giving this recipe 5 stars even though I had to make some big changes. I have a very strong feeling that this cake is fantastic as written. This was a spur of the moment thing as I needed to used up carrots. I had to use sucralose (hubs is diabetic). I substituted Kefir milk for buttermilk, I only had a small can of pineapple, I added pecans & some hemp seeds. No icing, either; just a dusting of 10X sugar. Delicious & moist! I want the real version so badly!
Flavor was off just a touch from what Iâ€™m used to and it was a huge recipe! But still good
My whole my loved it.
This was best carrot cake Iâ€™ve ever tasted. Very moist and flavorful. Only change I made was I used one cup of white sugar and one cup of brown sugar instead of 2 cups of white sugar.
Great recipe and easy to make. Very moist and quite dense. This will definitely be a "new" favorite

I made this for my son's birthday and of course being the good baker I had to taste since this was the 1st time making. Amazing! I had my 2 other older kids try also and they raved about for 2 days! Needless to say he doesnt quite have a full birthday cake now lol Oh, and I havent even frosted with cream cheese frosting yet....that's how good it is! Super moist and lots of flavor. I did add raisins, nuts and pineapple and it was perfect! I did make in a 9x13 pan and ended up taking about 50-55 minutes total to bake completely but will worth the time and effort!!

This was very moist and flavorful. Made it without pineapple because the rest of my family doesn't like pineapple. Also only used half the powdered sugar and add added walnuts to the frosting. I rarely follow recipes exactly.
I loved it, it's heavenly. My guests might've liked a bit less chunky with the pineapple and nuts, but that's how I made it and LOVE it!

Not a huge fan of shredded coconut, so omitted that, and sautÃ©ed the carrots with coconut oil instead. Came out delicious! Everyone absolutely loved the cake! I paired it with the whipped cream cream cheese frosting from here instead, just to cut the richness, and it was perfect! Definitely a keeper!

Fabulous!!! I have done a lot of baking, but this was my first attempt at carrot cake. I suppose I was intimidated and nervous it wouldn't turn out. Carrot cake is my absolute favorite cake by far. I cut the recipe in half, as I knew a whole recipe would be too much for two adults and a child. I used one round cake pan.

The recipe calls for 3 eggs, and I used two in this halved version. I believe this added to the nice moist texture.

The pineapple added deliciously sweet moisture. I didn't have crushed pineapple, but I did have a can of chunks. I took half of chunks from the can and chopped them finely.

For the frosting, I used a mixer to mix it together. The instructions don't say to do this, but I highly recommend it.

I used a convection oven to bake. It took 50 minutes on 325.

The only thing I plan on changing next time is the amount of spice used. I will add more cinnamon and some nutmeg next time. This is for my personal taste, as I enjoy foods that are richly spiced.

Very dependable recipe. The only changes I made, was to add a quarter tsp. cloves, a bit of nutmeg and some freshly ground ginger along with the cinnamon. It's my daughter's favorite spice combination and adapts very well with this cake. It's her birthday and I make her a carrot cake every year. She LOVES this cake.

I made this recipe yesterday with some adjustments.. I don't like pineapple so I got a ripe mango and chopped it up. Then I substituted 1 cup of white sugar for brown sugar. Plus, I used only 1 tsp of baking soda and added 2 tsp of baking powder since there is already salt in the recipe. Plus I added a 1/2 tsp of nutmeg for added flavor. it was easy and very moist. My husband loved it. I'm going to make it again for sure.
This was amazing! I canâ€™t recall having made a cake from scratch before, but I decided to attempt this just for fun. I loved it, and my family loved it. So yummy!
I love this recipe. I did add raisins and decreased oil to 1/2, cup then added 1/4 cup applesauce. This cake is so delicious.
It was moist and perfect!

I got so many compliments from this recipe. The only change i made was leaving out the coconut personal choice cause nobody in the house likes it With that said it had to be one of the best tasting carrot cakes i have ever made even after 3 days it was as moist then as ir was on the day of baking. Oh i also added raisins another personal choice. I will most definitely make this again i am already getting request, your recipes on here never disappoint.
My family loved it

Love it! And I donâ€™t even like carrot cake!! I didnâ€™t have canned pineapple so I used canned pears, I omitted the coconut flakes, I added a cup of raisins and I also used three 8 â€œ pans. The cake cake out so moist and just the right density.

My daughter wanted a homemade carrot cake for her birthday and this recipe delivered. I did not add coconut because she does not like it. Next time I am going to make two small round cakes and add coconut to one. Absolutely delicious and my carrot cake recipe for life.

I deviated from the recipe slightly. I did add a tsp each of nutmeg and ginger. I also divided the batter into 2 9in pans and then layered frosting between the 2 layers. Also, because of this, I doubled the frosting. Tasty and moist, very much liked.
AMAZING! A must try!
I made this cake for a baking contest and won! I added toasted coconut to the top and it was delicious!

I made this cake for our family Easter dinner dessert. Everyone loved it! (including me).
I will make it again.
This cake turned out great! I made this recipe as is and the family loved it!
Great recipe, very tasty and moist.

Didn't add the syrup from the pineapple, but it needed it, will add it for sure next time. Need extra confectioners sugar for the frosting in the hot & humid climate of South Thailand. We'll make this many times again.

I didnâ€™t love it, but it was ok. Iâ€™m not even sure exactly what was wrong, but Iâ€™ve had carrot cake before that grabbed me by the neck and pulled me in. Cake that demanded you eat every morsel. This cake was more and gentle invitation, but not a particularly urgent one.
Excellent recipe! I used 2 cream cheese & more confectionary sugar.

WOW! This was the best carrot cake we have ever tasted! We did make one change by accident. I grated up an entire bag of carrots (1 LB?) and had them in a bowl for my wife to measure out the 2 cups. She thought I had already measured out the 2 cups and threw in the entire bowl. I would have guessed it was closer to 3, maybe even 3.5 cups. The cake was so moist and delicious! Will make this again for sure.

Absulutely yummy and moist! Served it for a gathering, everyone loved it. Only I would cu the quantity for the frosting, it was way too much sugar on top. Also added a half of lemon juice to the frosting, that was perfect!

Quick and easy to prepare, moist but not too dense, and just the right amount of sweetness. The flavors were rich but perfectly blended. What more could you want in a cake? This got rave reviews from my mother and my mother in law who are both big fans of carrot cake. The only change I made was a substitution for the buttermilkâ€”I did not have any on hand so I used 1tablespoon of lemon juice added to 1 cup of milk. Seemed to work like a charm!
